title: Ellyse Perry's Six-Wicket Masterclass Sends Royal Challengers Bangalore to WPL Playoffs
content:
Ellyse Perry put on a show of power and precision in the Women's Premier League, securing a seven-wicket win for Royal Challengers Bangalore against Mumbai Indians. Perry achieved a historic feat, becoming the first bowler to take six wickets in a WPL match,  with a sensational spell of 6/15, the best-ever bowling figures in the tournament.  

This dominant performance saw Mumbai dismissed for a paltry 113, setting up a comfortable chase for Bangalore.  Perry's heroics weren't limited to bowling; she also anchored the chase with a crucial 40-run partnership with Richa Ghosh,  helping Bangalore reach the target in just 15 overs. 

This victory secured Bangalore's place in the WPL playoffs, showcasing Perry's invaluable contribution to the team.  Her all-round brilliance proved crucial in overcoming a formidable opponent, making her the standout performer in this crucial match.
